page.title: 16WALKS ,DUNTISBOURNE AREA
page.content: There are a few public footpaths in the area,well marked by signposts but not all passable today.Some staff of Hucclecote School followed a route , marked on the up-to-date O.S.map,which started immediately South of Winstone Church and cut diagonally across two fields,passed Rectory Farm and joined the road from Ermin Street into Duntisbourne Abbots.The first field was full,of barley so we had to divert around the side of the field and dodge the nettles and rabbit-holes.In Duntisbourne Abbots we picked up the second footpath which was our return route to winstone.This was well marked and looked well walked.The footpath follows a dry valley for half a mile,crosses a track and passes between two copses.A wide track leads pleasantly up to Winstone ,ending at Croft Farm,and 2 "listed" barns.
